name: How to Host an Amazing Event
html_description:
Join us to find out more about hosting an event during the Coventry and Warwickshire Business Festival 2019.

This informal event will run through the event application process, and everything you need to consider when planning your event.

The Coventry and Warwickshire Business Festival is an annual two-week festival, now in its third year. The festival will run from Monday 11th November - Thursday 21st November and will incorporate a wide range of free business events, run by the local business community. The festival aims to showcase what the region has to offer, drive economic growth and support local businesses.

Hosting an event as part of the festival is a great way to meet new people and gain exposure for your business. This event will also be an opportunity to find out more about the many other ways that your business can get involved with the Festival.

Agenda:

1:00 pm - Networking and Refreshments  
1:30 pm - Adam Brearley – Sales Manager, Coventry Conferences 
1:35 pm - Introduction - Jeremy Moore, CW Growth Hub
1:40 pm - Presentation - Associate Events: How to Host an Amazing Event 
2:20 pm - Questions
2:30 pm - Opportunity for 1:1 sessions with Associate Events staff
3:00 pm - Close 

Tours of The Techno Centre facilities will also be available.
Free parking is available at car parks A and B at the Techno Centre.

An exciting opportunity to join us at the official opening event for the Coventry and Warwickshire Business Festival 2019, along with many of the region’s key business leaders.

The Coventry and Warwickshire Business Festival, in its third year, aims to drive economic growth, inward investment and showcase the region. A fortnight of exciting business events will take place across Coventry and Warwickshire between November 11 and November 21, including seminars, lectures, workshops and conferences.

name: Tour De CSR
html_description:
Zoë's Place, in conjunction with festival Headline Partners - Inspire Insurance, would you like to invite you to join them on a Mystery Tour of Coventry, to identify "iconic" buildings and what they give back to society. Throughout this tour, we will offer ideas, best practices on how to "partnership" work.  The event is aimed at everyone in business! 

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is now a big part of the way most local companies operate in the UK. CSR is becoming more mainstream as forward-thinking companies attach sustainability into the core of their business operations to create shared values for business, local community and society. With this in mind, we want to work with your company to achieve your CSR aims and objectives.  

This event will include an interesting and informative talk from our key partner, Inspire Insurance with networking opportunities.

name: Reach the top of the customer experience mountain with Yak CX
html_description:
By 2020, Customer Experience will overtake price and product as the key differentiator. Are you ready? Join this hands-on workshop with Hannah to learn some tools and techniques to help your organisation put the customer at the heart of its growth strategy.

Customer Experience (CX)

- What is it & where does it fit in with your business & brand strategy?

- Who is your customer? Tips on building a customer persona

- Trek in your customers' shoes - Yak top tips for optimising each stage of your customer's journey

- Keep on Yak-ing - how to keep the focus to stay at the top

#bemoreyak 

Who is the event aimed at?

  • B2B organisations
  • Managing Directors
  • Operation Directors/Managers
  • Customer Service Directors / Managers
  • Marketing Directors/ Managers

What will attendees gain from attending the event?

  • Strategies for leading a customer-focused culture shift
  • Techniques to take back to their organisation to build greater focus on the customer in decision making
  • Best practice examples from market leaders

Agenda

1:15 pm - Workshop

2:30 pm - Break

2:45 pm - Workshop

16:30 pm - Finish

Yak CX - a boutique Warwickshire based b2b customer experience consultancy - helping businesses to #bemoreyak - resilient, consistent, prepared & recommended

venue_street: Avenue Farm Industrial Estate, Birmingham Road
name: How to identify your business's best potential export markets
html_description:
How much will pursuing the 'wrong' export markets cost your business this year, whether that's new or existing markets?  What if you could easily identify the best potential short- and medium-term export markets?  At this event, we will talk through a proven, data-based approach to defining and identifying potential export markets - which hundreds of Midlands businesses have already used to give them a shortlist of markets for focus (and further research).  

The event is suitable for all sectors, SMEs and medium-sized businesses.  Best suited to Export Managers, Business Development Directors and Managing Directors - whoever is in charge of growing international sales for the business.  Attendees will learn about a simple, proven framework for assessing potential markets using market data. They will gain insight into where to find sector- and market-specific data online that can be used to inform their market selection.  

Agenda: 

13:30: Arrive, coffee, networking

14:00: Presentation

15:00: Questions / discussion

15:15: Networking

Speaker:

Frances Long - Market Research Consultant. In the last 5 years, Frances has worked with over 475 Midlands businesses (through her work with DIT) to identify their best potential export markets.

name: Networking - The Essential Guide
html_description:
You are invited by the Socially Shared Women in Business Network and venue hosts - St Michael's Centre, to an event where you will learn all there is to know about networking.  Do you appreciate the benefits of networking, but shy away, find it too uncomfortable and a real chore? Do you network regularly but struggle to get results? If so this is the perfect event for you!

Meet other people that also want to improve their networking skills, polish their introductions, gain top tips and learn to love this essential and effective business activity.

You will be offered a warm welcome and have the opportunity to make valuable connections over a cuppa and cake.  Please note that Socially Shared is a Women in Business Network, however, this event is open to both men and women for this Business Festival event. 

Speakers: 

Karen Heap Founder of the Socially Shared Women in Business Network

Janice Cairns Centre Manager at St Michael's Centre

name: Warwickshire Cultural Briefing
html_description:
Join Heritage and Culture Warwickshire at this informative cultural briefing event where event attendees will get the chance to make contacts and share ideas in a unique venue which displays the Warwickshire Museum collections, including the Sheldon Tapestry, the recently acquired Roman Hoard and the Warwickshire dinosaur! 

Helen Peters Chief Executive of Shakespeares England will talk on the Tourism Zone BID and tourism in Coventry and Warwickshire. 

Curator Sara Wear will talk about the Tapestry Map which has been in the collection of the Warwickshire Museum Service since the 1960s. It was commissioned in the late 1580s by Ralph Sheldon (1537-1613) to decorate his newly built house at Weston, near Long Compton, in South Warwickshire. 

Attendees at this event will get the chance to learn about the history sharing community website 'Our Warwickshire' and share their personal history and business history.

The event is aimed at the tourism and hospitality sector but all businesses are welcome.


Agenda:

8 am - 9 am - Networking (coffee and pastries) / Demo of 'Our Warwickshire' website
9 am - 9.30 am - Helen Peters  - Chief Executive of Shakespeares England will talk on the Tourism Zone BID and Tourism in Coventry and Warwickshire
9.30 am -10 am - More chance to network and tour of the museum with the curators

Speaker: 

Helen Peters - Chief Executive of Shakespeares England

venue_street: 196 Wharfside St, Coventry University Technology Park
name: Collaborate to Innovate
html_description:
Are you a business eager to understand the meaning and the value of innovation and the link between innovation, collaboration and growth? Innovate UK is coming to the West Midlands to support the area’s growth ambitions and sector strengths. Put this date in your diary to meet experts who can help you take your business to the next level.

It’s hosted by organisations that focus on helping businesses collaborate, innovate and grow: Innovate UK, Knowledge Transfer Network, Europe Enterprise Network, the Catapult Centres in collaboration with regional and local partners including Innovation Alliance West Midlands and local Growth Hubs in the West Midlands.

This event is a unique opportunity to engage with key public and private funding and support organisations in the West Midlands – all in one room on the day.

What you will learn:

  • What makes a business successful
  • What is innovation and how can you get involved
  • How collaboration can fuel your innovation capability and business growth
  • The latest funding opportunities from Innovate UK, the National Funding Agency which supports business-led innovation
  • How to prepare for and write successful funding bids
  • What are the West Midlands sector strengths and growth priorities
  • How to connect to regional and local support networks and programmes you need to succeed

This event is for you if you are:

A business that hasn’t engaged with us before and wants to find out more about how we can help
A small or medium-size business or an academic organisation interested in innovation
Someone who is part of the innovation/ecosystem

Speakers:

The event will be opened by Dr Ian Campbell, Chief Executive of Innovate UK.

Keynote address from Sarah Windrum, CEO of the Emerald Group, Board Member of West Midlands Combined Authority and Board Director of Coventry and Warwickshire LEP. 

Panel experts will include:-

Jenny Tooth OBE, the CEO of the UK Business Angels Association

Peter Dines, COO of Mercia Asset Management Plc. 

Innovate UK sector leads, advisors from the Knowledge Transfer Network and Enterprise Europe Network, and experts from High-Value Manufacturing and Energy Systems Catapults will be on hand to discuss funding priorities, programmes and available support. Representatives from West Midlands-based companies will talk about the support and funding they received and how it helped their businesses grow.

name: Grow your business - Funding for innovative SMEs
html_description:
Through one to one mentoring and interactive workshops, this event will provide participants with all the information and support they need to unlock expert advice and financial support for innovation development leading to business growth.

Attendees will be greeted by one of the organising team members and based on a 121 discussion and a diagnostic form we will identify the business’s needs and will be able to provide you with personalised advice, recommending a combination of free workshops or 121 meetings with our business advisors, graphic designers, product testing researchers, innovation experts and academics specialised in different areas of the business/topics. Financial support is available to eligible companies in the form of both capital and revenue grants up to £15,000 for product or service development, low carbon initiatives and digital technology. 

SMEs and start-ups attending the event will have the opportunity to actively participate in taster interactive workshops on topics which have proved to be very sought after; Social Media in 2020, YouTube Video, Networking and Ideation. 

Participants at this event will also benefit from networking, sharing information and best practices with the other participants.

10:15 – 11:45 am: Social Media in 2020 

9:00 – 10:00 am: YouTube Video 

10:15 – 11:45 am: Ideation

name: Cracking the Trade Show Code
html_description:
Business shows are a great platform for promoting your business to a targeted audience. However, those who just show up and “throw up” a stand and simply hand out business cards, are missing a few tricks.
 
Exhibiting at a show takes some investment – and not just financial! You need to devote a bit of time and energy to planning your stand to ensure you’re getting the maximum return on your investment and to make it worth your while attending.
 
This session will walk you through how to set your strategy, identify and realise your goals and be well prepared for your next business show, ultimately driving footfall and sales to your door!
 
This 2-hour seminar will give you the toolkit you need to:

·       Set your measurable objectives and goals for attending a business show (great for tracking progress).

·       Grow and develop your customer base and network.

·       Design eye-catching and functional marketing to advertise your stand.

·       Create an interesting and interactive stand which represents your brand and draws customers in.

·       Engage with new and existing customers at the show and keep them chatting at your stand.

·       Follow up leads after the event – the most important part!

Nichola Kelsey and Rebecca Jones run The Micro Business Show, now in its third year. Microbusinesses include any business with 9 or fewer employees, freelancers, solo self-employed, start-ups and anyone thinking about starting up their own business. This event is aimed at this sector in the Midlands, providing an opportunity for learning and support through the annual exhibition of relevant stands, together with the knowledge-based seminar programme and plenty of networking opportunities. We work hard to make this event affordable for micro-businesses, with low stand prices for exhibitors and free entry for visitors. With a wealth of event and design experience between them, Nicholai and Becky are passionate about offering free support and guidance to exhibitors to ensure they make the most of their stand.
 
Any bookings for a stand at The Micro Business Show 2020 made at this seminar as part of the CW Business Festival will have the unique opportunity to select the precise location of their stand. Bookings made on other dates will have a stand allocated to them by the organisers.

html_description:

This 2-hour session will include time for networking and questions from the floor. The event is aimed at new start-ups and small to medium-size businesses who now need software to help them manage their business. Businesses will learn how software and good data management can help them give fantastic customer service and help them grow. Tea and coffee will be provided. 

Agenda
10:00 am – Refreshments and Networking

  • 4CRM and its Features

venue_street: Nunhold House, Hatton Technology Park, Dark Lane
name: Invest in employee health and wellbeing to reap the rewards!
html_description:
Join Core Clinics at this informative health and wellbeing-focused event to explore employee’s health issues and gain insight into the most effective ways to address issues with chronic health problems which can be stubbornly resistant to resolution. The impact of the menopause and the male ‘manopause’ on employee health and performance will also be explored. 
 
Chronic health problems which may affect employees and impact on business can include back pain, headaches, depression, anxiety, pain syndromes and IBS, amongst others. Resolving such problematic health issues is undoubtedly beneficial to employee wellbeing and also helps to improve workplace issues such as absence, long-term sick leave, presenteeism, and under-performance.   
 
The event will give business owners and managers inspiration and knowledge to help them improve their own health and wellbeing and the health and wellbeing of their employees and is open to all with particular suitability for HR managers, Small business owners, Company Directors. Applicable to all sectors and sizes of business.
 
This event is run by Core Clinics who were established in 2009 and are a leading multi-disciplinary healthcare clinic with an exceptional reputation both locally and nationally. Practitioners include medical doctors, allied healthcare professionals and complementary and alternative healthcare practitioners who work together in a highly-collaborative way.  

Specific sections will be run by our GP who has a special interest in men's health, our Clinical Director (specialist in chronic back pain, headaches, chronic pain, musculoskeletal problems and sports injury/performance) and our Registered Nutritionist.

Agenda: 

12.00 Arrival / register / welcome refreshments

12.15 Welcome and introductions

12.30 Opening session: Understanding the health and wellness challenges of our attendees

12.45 Session 1: Dr Jeff Foster (GP) on chronic medical conditions and men's health (including questions)

13.15 Session 2: Dr Stefaan Vossen (DC) on chronic pain, back pain and headaches. How to deal with them and steps to take to proactively reduce the future development of chronic pain conditions.

13.45 Session 3: Amy Cole (Registered Nutritionist and Functional Medicine Practitioner) on the role of nutrition in health and employee performance, and on women's health including menopause.

14.15 Closing discussion / questions

14.30 Main event will close at 14.30 but attendees are welcome to stay for further discussion (a member of the clinic team will be in attendance) and networking.

Speakers: 

Dr Stefaan Vossen (DC) Clinical Director Core Clinics

Dr Jeff Foster (GP) with special interest in men's health

Amy Cole: Registered Nutritionist and Functional Medicine Practitioner

venue_street: Venture House Business Centre, Avenue Farm Industrial Estate
name: Throwing away the rule book
html_description:
Have you ever worried about how you can keep the magic in your business as your team grows?  Have you ever thought you needed to ‘sort out your HR’ but then it went to the bottom of your list because it sounded boring?  It’s time to focus on throwing away the rule book:

• Everyday: Culture is what happens every day, not the one day you decide to focus on it

• Keep it real: Everyone has a difficult conversation that they’ve been putting off having but ignoring it doesn’t make it go away so be prepared to ‘bring out your dead’ at the session

• Love my job: Would your team say this if they were down the pub with their friends?

• The future is now: Have you got the team you need to grow your business?

• Flex appeal: Working 9-5 is so last century and flexible working is no longer a perk

• What’s being said (when you’re not around) is your real reputation

• Smooth operations: If you find your HR policies boring, everyone else will

This isn’t rocket science but so many leaders are not using these simple principles so why don’t you get ahead of the competition?  

The event is aimed at business owners and managers of teams often think that HR is boring or bureaucratic and try to avoid it for as long as they possibly can. This session will show them another way of leading their teams to grow their business.  This will be an informal session where we'll use question cards and conversations to share challenges around managing people and how to solve these. Attendees will come away with simple techniques to help them and an action plan for tackling their top HR challenges.  

Agenda: 

13:30 Refreshments & networking

14:00 Session starts

16:00 Session ends

Speaker: 

Sarah Tomson - Director & HR Consultant at Sarah Tomson Associates.

Sarah is passionate about throwing away the rule book that gets in the way of being a modern business owner. She believes that by keeping it real and having good conversations, leaders can build teams to boost the growth of their business.

She has seen the good, the bad and the downright ugly in her 18-year corporate HR career and is now on a mission to change the perception of HR with SMEs.

venue_street: Unit 5, Grove Business Park, Atherstone on Stour
name: Why the elusive work / life balance is a myth
html_description:
Feeling stressed and juggling many aspects of your life? Feeling guilty about not achieving all you want or compromises you're making in other areas? Join Motus at this informative 60-minute workshop where we will uncover the ‘Work / Life balance’ myth, explore what it means to you and give you the tools you need to live your life well, now.  Leave with some actions towards creating a future of health, wealth, success and happiness. 
 
This event is open to anyone with an interest in Personal and Organisational Wellbeing. 

In addition to one-to-one Coaching Programmes Motus also run Corporate Wellbeing programmes so HR Managers, Business Owners and those who make corporate decisions to prioritise the wellbeing of their people, are encouraged to attend.
 
Agenda:
 
Work / Life balance – why pursuing it could be doing more harm than good
 
The concept of "Adultitis"
 
Tools to live life well, now

Wellbeing for Team Performance

Speakers: 

Darren Putt, Founder, Motus Training

Meriel Swain, Founder, Sweet Success Coaching and Principal Associate at Motus Training

name: GDPR and Data Protection Update
html_description:
When this seminar takes place, it will be almost 18 months since GDPR came into force.  Has it affected your business? Have you done everything you should have? Are you aware of the repercussions of not adhering to the Regulation?  Do you have good protection in place in case things go wrong, or if you get caught out?

This seminar will focus on continuing compliance with GDPR and will help you to understand if your business is doing everything that it should. We’ll also hear about what the ICO has been up to with a review of enforcement and penalties.  

We will also hear from guest speaker, Ian McKinney of Gallagher, about how to minimise your exposure to the risk of loss, the extent of the insurance cover that is available and some of the risk management options you might wish to consider.

Agenda 

4.30 pm           Registration 

4.45 pm           Presentations and discussion

5.30 pm           Drinks and networking

6.30 pm           Close        

Confirmed Speakers:

Jon Wilby, Band Hatton Button

Ian McKinney, Gallagher

name: FSB Warwickshire and Coventry Small Business Conference
html_description:
Join the FSB at their annual small business conference for a chance to meet and network with fellow business owners from across the region.  This free event is open to all business owners and their guests. Registration is from 6pm with a light buffet available. The event will finish at 8pm with an opportunity for networking.

The event is aimed at small businesses and self-employed.  Attendees should attend for a chance for a business to business networking and hear from the FSB about recent activity and informative speakers about the latest developments in the area.  Attendees will gather an insight into what the FSB is doing for them across the region and receive policy updates on issues that may have an impact on their business locally. 

The theme for this year's event is around small businesses and how they help the local community following the FSB report 'Small Business Big Heart' which was published earlier this year.

Speakers:

  • Martin Sutherland, Chief Executive of UK City of Culture, Coventry 2021
  • Holly Nixon, local small business owner Holly Nixon
  • Victoria Roberts, Business Engagement Manager HS2

venue_street: George House, Herald Avenue, Coventry Business Park
name: How do we enhance Coventry & Warwickshire - a seminar on regional growth
html_description:
Join Deeley Group at our exciting event, where an in-depth research study will showcase how we can support the growth of Coventry and Warwickshire’s economy.   Coventry & Warwickshire LEP have commissioned a Market Signals and Market Intelligence Study to provide Coventry & Warwickshire’s Local Authorities, Warwickshire County Council and the LEP an update on current market conditions and employment supply in the region.

The authors of the study, SQW Limited (formerly BBP Regeneration) will detail the findings which include the need for a strong planning policy to ensure that the right sites are delivered on the right terms, and at a viable cost, together with a growing view that public and private sector collaboration is essential in order to achieve this agenda and support the region’s growth. 

Finally, putting the research into practice, David Harley, Head of Regeneration at Be First, will provide details on how Barking and Dagenham have tackled their economic challenges and in particular their work around employment / industrial intensification, the co-location of key uses, and specialist initiatives in specific sectors such as the development of new Film studios and maker space. 

This event is aimed at developers, contractors, architects, project managers and quantity surveyors but would also be suitable for businesses across the region who want to hear more about how your local authorities are working to put Coventry and Warwickshire on the map and drive economic growth.  We must share best practice and lessons learnt from other regions, to enable us to enhance our own. 

Agenda: 

08:00 am – Introduction to the Employment Market Signals Study (Bill Blincoe, Planning and Development Adviser, CWLEP & CW Growth Hub)

08:10 am – Findings from the Employment Market Signals Study (Rob Bennett, Associate, SQW)

08:40 am – Putting a Market Signals Study into practice (David Harley, Head of Regeneration, Be First)

09:00 am – Questions, Answers & Discussion

09:30 am – Close 

Speakers: 

Bill Blincoe, Planning and Development Adviser at Coventry & Warwickshire LEP and Coventry & Warwickshire Growth Hub

Rob Bennett, Associate, SQW Limited (formerly BBP Regeneration) a property, economic development and social development research consultancy

David Harley, Head of Regeneration at Be First. Be First are a pioneering, independent regeneration company, wholly owned by Barking and Dagenham Council

name: Organisational Resilience - Insulating Your Business Against the Shock of the Unknown
html_description:
Whether you are an SME or a supranational conglomerate, you need to identify an effective strategy to transcend risk and complexity when dealing with issues as diverse as climate change or Brexit. This is a session that spans three hours split between lecture, workshop, feedback and peer to peer mentoring sessions.

The following topics will be covered:

• Organisational resilience

• Supply chains and logistics

• Cybersecurity and data protection

• Managing uncertainty

• Intelligence, situational awareness and horizon scanning

The event is aimed at those with strategic level responsibility whether within small or large organisations.  

Speakers:

Emma Parkinson

Emma is Senior Lecturer in Emergency Planning and Management at Coventry University, where she delivers programmes on integrated emergency planning crowded places and risk management. Before becoming an academic, Emma specialised in crowd safety and large-scale security management, she continues to practice in both these fields as well as pursuing her research interests into near-miss reporting and the issues of risk management and emergency planning in temporary organisational cultures.

Wayne Harrop

Certified Higher Ed teacher currently teaching business continuity, risk management, crisis management and security management to industry resilience specialists from diverse multi-cultural backgrounds. Advanced experience of developing and reviewing business impact analysis, BCM strategy, policy, IMP, BCP, BRP, IMT structures, designing drills and exercises, maintaining and reviewing programme milestones against standards, compliance and good practice approaches. Proven ability to develop, maintain, and review Business Continuity Management Systems (BS 25999, and ISO 22301) having own three national awards for achievements in programme delivery, training and consultancy roles.

name: Taking England to the World
html_description:
Looking to expand into international markets? Looking to grow international sales?  Taking England to the World - is a one-day training programme, in conjunction with Google Digital Garage, which aims to help your business become international-ready. 

Developed as part of the government’s £40M Discover England Fund, this course is designed to equip you with the skills and foundations to develop and promote your product for sale in international markets.  

This training programme is aimed at suppliers from all sectors of the English travel industry – from accommodation to attractions, and from excursions to experiences. Whilst particularly suitable for SMEs, larger organisations are also welcome to attend.  

Attendees will gain in-depth knowledge of how to ensure their 'product' is travel trade ready and attractive to an international market.  This event is to help Tourism businesses engage with the international travel trade, to ensure they are 'trade fit' and thus drive international and especially long haul footfall to the area.

name: Get into Rail
html_description:
Join 'University of Birmingham' at the return of this popular event - 'Get into Rail', to be held at Quinton Rail Technology Centre. The event will focus on emerging and existing supply opportunities within the rail sector and will explore the rail mentoring programme which enables SMEs to:

  • Discover the opportunities, drivers and key players in the rail sector

  • Develop an understanding of what they need to do to get ready for rail

  • Understand the funded support mechanisms available

  • Develop an action plan to move your company forward

This event will help raise the profile of the Coventry & Warwickshire rail sector and cross-sector opportunities for the auto, aero and advanced manufacturing, cyber and creative and digital sectors. 

The event is primarily aimed at local SMEs to help better understand and access the rail supply chain opportunities. It is also aimed at the rail industry, media, intermediaries and local and regional government to raise the profile of Coventry & Warwickshire as a location for rail R&D and inward investment.  Attendees will gain a better understanding of UK rail supply chain opportunities, access to information and introduction to relevant networks, including the ERDF funded Digi-Rail Programme.

Agenda: TBC

Speakers: TBC

name: Is your business story compelling enough?
html_description:
This interactive half-day session is in two parts. The first examining the history and theories of storytelling and working on how to go about telling your story. The second invites you to work with other delegates on each others’ stories and guides you towards the raw materials of your story or a proposition, to sum up ‘the moral’ of your story. Ideal for owner-managers, board members responsible for marketing or marketing managers of small and medium enterprises of 10 plus people. Storytelling is being used corporately to unify teams, drive leadership initiatives and project consistent and compelling sales and marketing messages. Why shouldn’t SMEs benefit from the same advantages that corporates do? 

Delegates will understand the commercial benefits of story-telling and get to grips with how to put together a story. In the second half of the session, delegates will work on identifying and expressing their own compelling story. Working towards the raw materials that can be used to distil that in a consistent way, or towards a singular proposition or strapline that does the same.  

The event is being repeated in the afternoon.

name: How to Generate a Consistent Stream of B2B Website Leads in 2020 (Coventry)
html_description:
Do you sell to other businesses? Register for Mark's workshop today and discover how to get more high-quality leads and meetings with prospects. Improve your B2B website and digital marketing strategy in 2020. Make selling easier. 

Today the Internet is a source of almost all the information your buyer needs. “

"70% of a buyer’s research is done before they talk to sales. 59% of buyers prefer not to talk to sales at all.” – Source: Aligned To Achieve Selling is hard. 

There’s increased competition on the Internet. 

The power is with your buyer. 

Customers are doing more and more of their research before they talk to sales. So marketing’s influence over the sales process is ever increasing. 

“70% of the buying decision is made before someone talks to a salesperson.” 

In 2020 your website and digital marketing need to work harder than ever to generate a consistent stream of quality leads. If you're a B2B company, register today and get more high-quality leads next year.

Attendees at this workshop will gain the following:-

  • Best practice examples from leading UK B2B websites

  • Strategies for impressing customers at every stage of the customer journey. 

  • Strategies for increasing the number of people who get in touch via your website. 

  • Tactics to make the selling easier by generating higher quality leads. 

  • Tactics to start sales conversations earlier in the customer journey

This event is aimed at:- B2B organisations, Managing Directors, Marketing Directors / Managers, Sales Directors / Managers.

name: Gin Tasting at Fargo!
html_description:
Join Alsters Kelley Solicitors and Armstrongs Chartered Accountants at this informative session, where you will receive an update on the exciting things happening at FarGo Village, have the opportunity to sample a few flavours of gin and hear how a local business has ensured continued success.

Lucy Thompstone from FarGo Village will talk through the exciting developments taking place at The Box and the aspirations for FarGo in the future.

Pete Viggers from Buzzards Valley Vineyard is our business speaker for the session. Pete will share the story of how the award-winning family business has developed since it began in 1962, including the exciting diversification into the production of gin, which has been fantastic for the company.

Pete will be bringing along a number of different gin flavours for delegates to try. If you like what you sample, bottles will be available to purchase and would make an ideal Christmas present for family or friends.

Our event is aimed at local business people and individuals who want to build new connections in the Coventry & Warwickshire area, whilst hearing the exciting story about how a local Vineyard has diversified into the production of gin. 

We hope that attendees will meet new connections in a relaxed setting and will enjoy getting to sample a few flavours of gin. The story that Pete will tell shows how the business has developed and has thrived by diversifying its product range.

html_description:
How well do you know or want to know the companies or people you trade with?  In today’s ever-changing world this is an important question.  Every day we see more and more unethical behaviour in businesses, leaving them open to legal and financial penalties that could tarnish their brand increased risks that could ultimately lead to loss of business.

name: Design for Manufacture and New Product Introduction
html_description:
This presentation and workshop will look to help those who are looking to manufacture a product for the first time. Often manufacturing is considered far too late in a project and a lot of the cost down opportunities or capital investment implications are missed. Matthew Statham is a chartered manufacturing engineer who spent his career both in the automotive and in small manufacturing companies before founding his own business 14 years ago helping companies take their ideas into production. With a wealth of experience in a variety of product manufacturing processes, Matthew offers valuable insights to those starting a business without an existing supply chain and manufacturing infrastructure.

The session is aimed at startup or small businesses looking to move their product from concept into the manufacture and wishing to reduce upfront investment/production costs, avoid costly mistakes and project delays!  

Attendees will gain:

  • A better understanding of the stages to take a product into manufacture.
  • A clearer picture of timing and cashflow implications associated with manufacturing your new product.

name: How to Massively Grow Your Business Using LinkedIn
html_description:
* Please note: This event has now sold out. For further information or to be placed on the waiting list, please email Paul Bedford at pauljbedford@googlemail.com. If you have a place but can no longer attend, please email hello@cwbusinessfestival.com to cancel *

How to Massively Grow Your Business Using LinkedIn!  As part of the Coventry & Warwickshire Business Festival, I'm going to run this course for free. It would normally cost £137.  99% of people are using LinkedIn wrong.  They don't understand the platform and how to use it to bring in a steady stream of warm leads into their business. Did you know that there are four types of people that use LinkedIn?  Three of these types aren't getting the results they want.

Here they are:

1. The Sales Bombardier - They send a connection request (usually with no introduction) and then SPAM you, and bombard your inbox with loads of sales pitches.

2. The Phantom - Connects with people on LinkedIn and expects sales to magically appear without interacting with people, starting conversations or building relationships.  

3. The Social Butterfly - These are the complete opposite of the Phantoms.  They know their leads, put out great content, invest time engaging with them ... but never take their relationship off social media.

The fourth type is The Strategist ...

  • Their messages get a response
  • They build relationships
  • They book offline conversations
  • They generate new clients
  • They've never said "I'm not getting any clients from social media"

In this 3 hour information-packed course I'm going to go through the "obvious" things you should be doing on LinkedIn (that you're not), but also the things that only the Strategist does... specifically how to get sales opportunities and make the most of them.

The first step to LinkedIn success is to choose your target market.

I'll show you:

  • What shot-gun marketing is and why it doesn't work
  • Why laser sharp focus on your target market will revolutionise your business
  • What a client Avatar is and how to define yours
  • The biggest mistake I made in getting 14,000+ connections on LinkedIn
  • What I would do if I could start all over again
  • The TOC formula and what it means to your business

The second step to LinkedIn success is to utilise your profile to its maximum extent... and aim it at your target market.  

I'll show you:

  • The worst types of profile picture you can have
  • 3 proven ways to disappear on LinkedIn and blend into the background
  • The 7 biggest things you can do to your profile to make an impact
  • 5 ways to "trick" LinkedIn and make yourself stand out from the crowd
  • The way to structure your About section to make it magnetic to your target audience
  • What LSO is and how to appear when people search LinkedIn
  • Why putting more detail into your profile is better than being "mysterious" with less

The third step to LinkedIn success is to post regular and great content.

I'll show you:

  • Why articles are worthless, but why you need them and how many you should have on your profile
  • How often you should be posting content on LinkedIn and the best times of day to do it
  • What content works and what will crash and burn
  • How to use the AIDA principle when creating posts
  • 10 examples of my posts that got in excess of 10,000 views
  • 5 engagement strategies that will boost the visibility of your posts
  • How to make sure your posts are exposed to the maximum audience possible

The fourth step to LinkedIn success (and probably the most important) is to have a structured Sales Process.

I'll show you:

  • The "Know - Like - Trust" formula
  • The number 1 thing you MUST not do on LinkedIn that most people ignore
  • I'll share what's the most valuable: Likes, Comments or Shares
  • What triggers are, what they mean and how to use them
  • The exact sales process I used to bring in hundreds of thousands of pounds in profit over the last 6 years
  • How to build trust with your prospects before they've met you - so it's a slam dunk when they do!
  • The most powerful tool on LinkedIn for building relationships (or any social media for that matter)
  • How to get your prospects off social media, on to a phone call and then into a face to face conversation

This event will most likely never happen again...

I kid you not - I HAVEN'T run this seminar for nearly a year. The keys to my success on LinkedIn aren't rocket science ... but they make sense.  I'll give you practical advice to make the most of this amazing business vehicle.

I may never run this again ... I've got a great business and it doesn't rely on helping other business owners to make the most of LinkedIn.

So book yourself on this seminar now.  There are limited places. Last time I ran this, we had a waiting list, so don't miss out ...

Here's some feedback from my clients:

"I have been on several courses with Paul.  He has an entertaining and engaging style of presentation. He makes the subject area both interesting and actionable.  In fact, I actioned several things whilst I was there!  Thoroughly recommended!"

"Paul demonstrated a unique and creative/knowledgeable understanding of different marketing strategies.  Happily shared his brilliant insights that have been immediately applicable to business.  Thank you."

"Extremely useful course; I was a novice before completing the course now I feel more confident in putting all the training into practice. Thank you, Paul."

Agenda 

Meet at the event for about 08:45 am to grab a coffee... Power through with information and helpful exercises until 12:00 noon.

You can grab a coffee at any time during the course.

name: SME - HR Resource and Support Centre
html_description:
The Coventry and Warwickshire Employability Group are a partnership working group composing of the Chamber of Commerce, Senior HR Professionals, local employers, LEP and Local Authority representatives.  The Employability Group are hosting an event to raise awareness and alley SME fears of high-cost advice. The event will provide information and advice on different scenarios for managers and employees in the workplace. SMEs tend to worry more of the cost associated with advice than actually obtaining the professional advice that is needed when a situation arises in the workplace - this event will provide free advice and reduce fears of associated costs.

This event is aimed at small and medium-sized enterprises, including owners but also employees. All are welcome to attend but the event’s main focus is on benefiting SMEs and their attitude towards costs, issues in the workplace and SME opportunities.  

Attendees will gain useful information and advice regarding the management and well-being of employees, possible employee-related issues that may occur in the workplace, and SME business support.  Topics covered will include; the benefits of placement work and the funding available for businesses when taking on apprentices, employment law for SMEs, tackling employee well-being in SMEs, supporting parents and new parents at work, avoiding maternity discrimination, the impact of increasing involvement with local schools to promote careers, and the benefits of flexible working.

Attendees will have exposure to invaluable tools that can be adopted and implemented in their business in addition to support and advice from speakers in their fields of expertise, and real-life case study examples.

Naturally, there is also the opportunity to meet other local and like-minded SME businesses similar to yours.  

The event will run as an exhibition like session whereby speakers will be set up around the venue room and attendees can circulate the room to visit the stands and speakers that they find most useful to their business or business issue. In this way, attendees can obtain only the information they want without having to stay for the whole event duration if it were scheduled as a lecture like presentation. Furthermore, this will allow attendees the opportunity to ask speakers questions that they may have regarding certain topics, without the worry of having to ask the question and receive the answer in a large crowd.  

Speakers:

Still, TBC but possible speakers include:

Mike Woolnough, National Sales Director of Perks Direct, speaking of the Perks Direct Employee Benefits Platform.

Angela Roberts, Director of The HR Consultancy, speaking of HR procedures to aid SMEs.

Eva Harrison, speaking of the importance why employers need to understand the younger generation as they have a thirst for knowledge.

Navneet Rai speaking of the funding available to businesses when taking on apprentices, business benefits, the benefits of industry placement and work experience students, supported internships and school engagement.

David Lennox, speaking of how employers can increase/improve their involvement with the schools and colleges across Coventry and Warwickshire to promote careers in different sectors.

Mark Larner, speaking of health and wellbeing at work, including the implemented various strategies and offering experiences and examples of real-time efforts to reach a diverse workforce.

Other possible speakers include; Pauline Whiteman, Sarah Windurm, Deborah Unitt, Wendy Coy and Sally Dhillon.

name: The Digital Railway
html_description:
This event will provide an overview of the Digital Railway (what is it, what will it be, and the drivers of change). It will also detail the work done by the University of Birmingham and UKKRIN's centre for digital systems in fostering research, innovation and rail product and service development.

Finally, the event will talk about DIGI-RAIL, an ERDF funded project aimed at supporting local SMEs to access support from the university.  

The event is aimed at local SMEs, either those currently in rail or those who have the capacity/interest to supply rail, to give them an overview of rail opportunities and how to access them.

name: Finance for Non-Financial Managers
html_description:
This workshop will aim to boost the competence of senior managers in the theory and practical everyday use of key financial documents so that they may be more confident in their business dealings with team members, investors, bankers, customers and suppliers. The workshop will explain the key financial statements and how to interpret them, including profit and loss, balance sheet and cashflows. The event is designed to help business owners, entrepreneurs and non-financial managers appreciate the key concepts of finance and how this understanding can be used to help improve their performance.

Competencies gained from this workshop will enable participants to more effectively:

  • Use forecasting techniques to set budgets and performance targets
  • Monitor spending and performance
  • Consider, project and manage options for change
  • Control their business and inspire confidence in stakeholders to secure commitment, teamwork and whatever is needed to support everyday success and growth.

Agenda:

3.5 hours duration: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm covering the following topics:

  • I thought accounts were for accountants! What are the key financial statements - why do they matter to me and my business? What are they telling us; how to interpret them and how others will interpret them?
  • Profit and loss - A quick look at how each of the elements is treated that makeup business income, expenditure and overheads.
  • The balance sheet in detail - Taking a snapshot of your business - what can we learn?
  • The cashflow forecast - How to use common sense to build up a picture of our business future. The key difference between profit and cash, demonstrating the issues of working capital.

Speaker:

Paul Heaven - Managing DIrector, Jerroms Corporate Finance

name: Biodiversity at Wolford Wood
html_description:
With the bourgeoning revival of an outdoor learning curriculum, how do we make places like Wolford Wood an accessible Warwickshire Centre for Well-being and Productivity? Join us at Wolford Wood and gain a sense of wonder – 150 acres (60ha.) of Warwickshire Scientific and Working Woods. See what we will be offering your business and employees throughout the next 30-years.

See how effective your organisation's well-being programme could be. Bring a group today and enjoy the outdoors in the fresh air, try your hand, take a close look at biodiversity and walk-in big woods. Enjoy our outdoor kitchen under the oak trees.

The event is aimed at: 

  • Any size company which would like to bring a group to the event as a team-building morning. 
  • HR and Wellbeing Managers.
  • Schools.
  • Care sector and their sponsors.  

What will attendees gain:

  • Your own morning of wellbeing.
  • Team building with colleagues.
  • See how Wolford Wood could be a venue for your organisation.
  • Access the wood for your client base.
  • Find out about sponsorship opportunities for e.g. school children.

Wolford Wood is a privately-owned working woodland.   This rare 150-acres of scientific wood is protected and commercially managed for the benefit of the woodland habitat and its indigenous biodiversity.  The woodland is classed as Ancient & Historic with plantation Ash and Oak. Hazel, Birch, Willow and Sweet Chestnut is coppiced to order and as part of a 30-year management plan approved by The Forestry Commission and English Nature. As a way to sustain its future, Wolford Wood can be booked as a venue for selected events and private parties.

Agenda: 

10-10.30am - Arrival and registration, tea, coffee

10.30 am - Moth and plant identification. 

10.40 am - Introduction to Wolford Wood, its biodiversity and partnership organisations. The wellbeing activities available here and opportunities for investment and sponsorship.

11 am - Corporate groups assemble, other delegates assemble

Activities available: archery, pole-lathe, bee-keeping, woodland clay kitchen

Head off on walks through the wood with guides and experts

12/1 pm - Finish

name: How to Generate a Consistent Stream of B2B Website Leads in 2020 (Leamington)
html_description:
Do you sell to other businesses? Register for Mark's workshop today and discover how to get more high-quality leads and meetings with prospects. Improve your B2B website and digital marketing strategy in 2020. Make selling easier.

Today the Internet is a source of almost all the information your buyer needs. “

"70% of a buyer’s research is done before they talk to sales. 59% of buyers prefer not to talk to sales at all.” – Source: Aligned To Achieve Selling is hard. 

There’s increased competition on the Internet. 

The power is with your buyer. 

Customers are doing more and more of their research before they talk to sales. So marketing’s influence over the sales process is ever increasing. 

“70% of the buying decision is made before someone talks to a salesperson.” 

In 2020 your website and digital marketing need to work harder than ever to generate a consistent stream of quality leads. If you're a B2B company, register today and get more high-quality leads next year. 

Attendees at this workshop will gain the following:-

This event is aimed at:- B2B organisations, Managing Directors, Marketing Directors / Managers, Sales Directors / Managers.

Agenda

name: Digital Innovations Supporting Business Growth
html_description:
Innovation is becoming increasingly important for businesses to stay ahead of their competitors and maximise commercial success. Innovation comes in many forms and varieties such as clever software or a technical invention.  NatWest Business / Commercial Banking is delighted to bring together expertise from Burgis & Bullock Accountants and Lombard Asset Finance for a practical seminar around digital innovations and the benefits to your business covering the following:

• Research & Development / Patent Box tax credits – understand how this can help fund your innovation activities

• Cloud Accounting – How automating your daily accounting admin can save time in your business, get you closer to your financials and ensure you are compliant for making tax digital

• Lombard Asset Finance - Intellectual Property and Green Funding through asset finance and how this unique way to fund supports your business growth ambitions

• NatWest Digital Innovations – Emerging, innovative technologies that are enhancing services provided to clients to support the changing sector landscape

Speakers 

Sean Farnell Partner, Corporate & Specialist Services – Burgis and Bullock Chartered Accountants

Sean Farnell is a Corporate and Specialist Services Partner at Burgis & Bullock Chartered Accountants.

His clients range from SMEs and family-owned limited companies to large companies, focusing on non-regulated services particularly providing business advice, systems support, profit growth and advice on wealth retention.

He also runs the business coaching and development arm of the practice, covering all the firm's offices, working one-to-one with clients and making presentations at events across the UK as well as having responsibility for IT and marketing at the firm.

Sean has experience of working with many different industries and a specific interest in harnessing emerging and established technologies for smaller business’ benefit and is driving the change to greater efficiencies using innovation and cloud technologies.

He has been a CWLEP board member since 2013 and is also a board member of Coventry & Warwickshire Reinvestment Trust (CWRT).

Anne Rose - Head of Tax at Burgis & Bullock Chartered Accountants

‘Anne is Head of Tax at Burgis & Bullock. She specialises in all aspects of corporate tax for businesses of all sizes, including owner-managed companies, foreign-owned entities and companies with PE backing. The tax code for UK companies is one of the most complicated in the world and despite a falling headline Corporate Tax rate, there are many complexities to negotiate. Anne and the team at Burgis and Bullock can help you organise your company’s affairs in a tax-efficient way.

Anne is currently helping many companies across a wide range of industries with making successful Research and Development tax credit relief claims as well as advising on the highly advantageous Patent Box relief. Both these regimes can have significant cashflow advantages, either by reducing a company’s tax bill or by providing a cash payment to the company; the government is seeking to support and reward innovative companies through the tax system. 

Anne is both an ICAEW qualified accountant and a Chartered Tax Advisor which enables her to assist companies with a full range of tax advisory and compliance services. She has 25 years of experience in providing these services, including 20 years working at EY in the Midlands.

name: Planning & Biodiversity – A Seminar to Aid Development
html_description:
Over the past 12 months, there have been significant changes to the planning system, and even more emphasis put into biodiversity.  We have therefore secured expert industry advice from two leading organisations:  Barton Willmore: a leading planning and design agency who from their 13 offices nationwide combine national influence with local knowledge to offer their clients the very best advice.  Wharton Natural Infrastructure Consultants: Wharton sees trees, ecology and habitats as assets rather than development constraints. They provide the practical and innovative solutions you need to naturally increase the true value of your land or property. At the same time, keeping a balance between commercial, environmental and human needs.  

This event is aimed at housing associations, developers, contractors, architects, project managers and quantity surveyors but would also be suitable for businesses who want to understand more about the planning process.  Attendees will gain a better understanding of the process and the requirements that you must meet to deliver biodiversity requirements on site.  

Agenda:

08:00 am – Planning Seminar (Kathryn Ventham, Partner, Barton Willmore & Gemma Johnson, Planning Associate, Barton Willmore)

08:20 am – A focus on Biodiversity (Peter Wharton, Director, Wharton Natural Infrastructure Consultants)

08:40 am – A developers view (Anthony Holt, Deeley Group Development Director)

08:50 am - Questions, Answers and Discussion

09:30 am – Close

Speakers: 

Kathryn Ventham, Partner, Barton Willmore

Gemma Johnson, Planning Associate, Barton Willmore

Peter Wharton, Director, Wharton Natural Infrastructure Consultants

Anthony Holt, Deeley Group Development Director

name: Good Mental Health for You and Your Work Force
html_description:
Coventry University specialises in supporting the health and wellbeing of your employees, offering training, education and information on how productivity can be maximised through improved mental health and wellbeing initiatives. This event will explore techniques on how you can implement small but effective changes to support your employees. Suitable for small to large organisations, our academic experts, will share the latest thinking and tips from their research.  

This event is aimed at businesses of any size to learn about how they can help improve the health and wellbeing of their workforce. Coventry University is proud to provide practical knowledge from its research and industry collaborations, to help improve the productivity and success of businesses in the local area.  

Delegates will gain insights into practical ways to help improve their workforce health and wellbeing and have the opportunity to engage with experts in the area.

Agenda:

9.00am - Registration

9.30am - 9.40am - Welcome to the Event – Overview of Mental Health Productivity Pilot, Adam Layland

Coventry University, alongside the University of Warwick and the West Midlands Combined Authority, is leading a pilot programme over the next three years to improve mental health and productivity across the midlands area. Find out more about this initiative and how you can become involved.

9.40am - 10.00am - How sports can enhance your business and staff mental health Looking at the Sports Partnerships, Dr Sam Oxford

Sporting activities are a great way to engage your workforce and not only has physical benefits to employees but greatly improves their mental health too. Hear about the initiatives Coventry University has with many sports clubs and how we are supporting the British Transplant Games in Coventry next year.

10.00am - 10.20am - Agile working for your workforce: what're the benefits? Dr Christine Grant

Dr Grant’s research has demonstrated the many ways in which operating an agile workforce can improve productivity and engagement within your organisation.

10.20am - 10.40am - Tips to help improve your staff wellbeing, Dr Karen Maher

What are the best things to do to help improve your staff wellbeing? We’ll share with you the top tips available from tried and tested areas.

10.40am - 11.00am - Q&A with refreshments and networking

11.00am - 11.45am - Laughter Yoga Session: supporting wellbeing in your workplace, Dr Martin Bollard and Louise Gates

Take part in our taster session exploring the physiological and psychological benefits of laughter yoga.

11.45am - Health Checks

We will be offering free health checks to all attendees and specialist advice from our academics and practitioners.

Networking Opportunity and Refreshments.  

Speakers:  

Adam Layland, Associate Dean Enterprise and Innovation

Dr Sam Oxford, Associate Dean Enterprise and Innovation 

Dr Christine Grant, Deputy Head of School

Dr Karen Maher, Assistant Professor in Occupational, Business and Organisation Psychology

Dr Martin Bollard, Associate Head of School

Louise Gates, Health and Life Sciences

name: LinkedIn Powerful Profiles
html_description:
This is a 2-hour training session aimed at helping business owners or members of your team to learn how to utilise LinkedIn effectively. This event is aimed at business owners or team members who use LinkedIn.

Attendees will gain knowledge on:
* How to set up your personal page 
* How to be found 
* How to connect 
* How to search 
* What to post.

Speakers:

Amy Foster 
Adam Payne

name: Coventry & Warwickshire's LARGEST Speed Networking
html_description:
The Chamber is well known for the strength of its networking opportunities, offering the chance for businesses across Coventry & Warwickshire to make new connections, build sustainable relationships and cement existing ones.  As part of the Coventry & Warwickshire Business Festival, we are delivering the LARGEST speed-networking event in our region to facilitate an opportunity to bring people together and do business!

Speed Networking is high energy, fast-paced and offers an unrivalled opportunity to meet many contacts in a short period of time.  

This event is open to all businesses across Coventry & Warwickshire who want to grow their network, make new connections and enjoy a fast and furious Speed Networking session.  

With around 200 businesses in the room, this is a fast route to meeting lots of new contacts whom you might be able to do business with! 

Agenda: 

2.00 pm - Arrival, registration & refreshments

2.30 pm - Welcome from Chamber

2.40 pm - Explanation of how Speed Networking works!

2.45 pm - Speed Networking

4.30 pm - General Networking and a chance to catch up with people you've met

5.00pm - Event Close

The event will be hosted by the Chamber of Commerce team members.

venue_street: ECG4 Ground Floor, Enterprise Centre, Technology Park
name: Meet the Bank of England
html_description:
An exclusive roundtable event for small businesses with the Bank of England regional representative. This roundtable session is for small businesses to help provide feedback on business conditions in the current economic climate to the Bank of England.

Discussions will focus on demand, output, costs and prices, employment and pay settlements affecting small businesses across all sectors over the past quarter. Attendees will also hear from the Bank of England regional representative for the West Midlands who will provide an overview of the economy before a discussion with business representatives

This event is aimed at the self-employed/small businesses.

Speaker:

Graeme Chaplin - West Midlands Bank of England representative.

An agenda will be circulated to attendees a week before the event takes place.

venue_name: Coventry University, Charles Ward Building, Room CW 152
name: 150 million reasons to engage with students
html_description:
With 2 top 15 universities in Coventry, there are over 50,000 students between them. This event is designed to discuss the economic and social value of the students to the local area, the student pound and how to engage your business with them. The event is aimed at any business that wants to improve their engagement with students. This can be economic or social based, looking at how to encourage students to spend with a business for a share of the valuable student pound, or are looking to engage with students on a social and community level; from volunteering to placements and beyond.

What will attendees gain from attending this event? University students are playing an increasingly important part in the local economy, with it projected that students spend £150m+ annually in the region. This is a chance for local businesses to get a better understanding of the students at Coventry University. Latest trends, key drivers behind their decision making, where they spend their money and the best ways to attract them to engage with your business. 

Speakers: 

Dan Connolly - Director of Communications

Over 15 years working for and with Students' Unions with a background in developing technology to engage and empower students.

Michael Nortey - Client Relationship Manager

20 years of experience of managing B2B relationships from FTSE 100s to SMEs. Responsible for opening links between local and national businesses and students at Coventry University.

Paul Muller - Enterprise & Events Manager

With 20 years experience of event management, Paul is responsible for the organisation of events across the Students' Union to engage students and the wider community. These include Coventry Festival of Running and Coventry Comedy Festival.

More speakers to be announced.

venue_street: Techno Centre, Coventry University Tech Park, Puma Way
name: Intrapreneurship: Solving Organisational Problems By Utilising Your Own Resources
html_description:
This event will examine how a Coventry-based charity – the Coventry Refugee and Migrant Centre - utilised its employees and clients’ expertise and passion to create an easily replicated, self-sustaining business that offers a solution to a sector-wide problem. Attendees to this event are invited to participate in this 1.5 hour interactive, innovative and intrapreneurial workshop, led by Social Enterprise professionals.

Practical tips and best practice will be shared to help create solutions to critical business problems while utilising the range of resources within your organisation. 

Agenda
5.30pm: Registrations and Refreshments
6.00pm: Welcome and Introduction
6:10pm: Presentation
6.30pm: Interactive workshop
7:05pm: Sharing Findings
7:25pm: Conclusion and End

Speakers

Inderjit Sahota- Social Enterprise Manager, CRMC
Victor Iringere- Social Enterprise Coordinator-CRMC
Anastasia Chokuwamba -Cleaning Operative, Spring Action Cleaning
Jen Preece - Project Manager, Mi Friendly Cities

name: Festive Stollen Workshop
html_description:
This event has now sold out. We have some limited availability if you wish to attend and take your bread home to bake. Please contact:-  breadforlifeuk@gmail.com

Bread for Life is a local company who specialises in educational workshops, team away days and social baking events. Following their popular experiential artisanal baking events last year, Bread for Life invite you to join them at this special festival-edition of their delicious ‘Festive Stollen Workshop’. 

Using locally milled flours, boozy soaked fruits, with a selection of quality ingredients, each guest will learn how to make and bake their own festive stollen with homemade marzipan filling. The music will be playing, the decs will be out and there will be plenty of festive spirit! Everyone will take home their delicious festive stollen along with the recipe to make again leading up to the Christmas period. 

Agenda

7pm Arrival for mulled wine
7.15pm Mixing and kneading
7.45pm Make marzipan
8pm Break for nibbles and mulled wine/networking
9pm Shape stollen and proving time
9.30pm Bake *
10pm Finish

* Please note: Guests may bake their stollen at the event or take it home ready to bake. 

This event is suitable for all, from novice to experienced bakers.   

This is a chargeable event at £12.00 per person and includes nibbles and hot mulled wine.

name: Improving Team Performance
html_description:
Teams that are confident, productive, innovative and engaged can increase the overall effectiveness of your organisation by 100%! This session will give hints and tips on how to engage with your teams more effectively which will ultimately improve your company's effectiveness.

The event is aimed at anyone who works in a team or has responsibility for a team.  You will gain ideas and techniques on how to improve your team's performance.  

The event will look at the psychology of teams, how they work together, what barriers can be found in teams and how to remove them. There will be some practical activities and some theories on how to make improvements.  

Agenda

8:15am – 8:30am – Registration and Coffee
8:30am – 8:35am – Welcome and Introduction
8:35am – 8:45am – Evaluate Your Team – Is your team performing as well as it could?
8:45am – 9:05am – The Stages of Team Development – At what stage is your team?
9:05am – 9:25am – Understanding Team Roles – Who’s who in your team and what role do they play?
9:25am – 9:45am – The Hive Mindset – Do your team members think as one?
9:45am – 10am – Bringing Everyone Together/Summary

Speakers

Jav Mohammed Leadership & Management Consultant (BA Hons)

Judi McSweeney HR Consultant (FCIPD)

venue_name: Coventry City Council, Dame Ellen Terry Suite
name: Very Light Rail Opportunities
html_description:
Very Light Rail (VLR) is a new rail sector focused on vehicles which are both lightweight and self-propelled (battery-powered). They are an environmentally friendly, low-cost form of public transport.   Coventry City Council will use VLR to solve its public transport needs and to ease congestion on the city’s roads.  There is an opportunity for local businesses to work with the scheme promoters in the development of new VLR technologies which will also result in an innovation ‘boost’ for SMEs in the region.

This event is aimed at a small to medium-sized business based in the Coventry and Warwickshire region and businesses will be able to find out how they can contribute to the scheme, over the next few years.

Attendees will gain a chance to register interest for involvement with the scheme going forward. Understand how the scheme adds to the growth of the local economy and current investment in Coventry and Warwickshire.

Speakers:

Cllr Jim O'Boyle - Coventry City Council 
Colin Knight, Director of Transport & Highways - Coventry City Council 
Nick Mallinson - WMG

venue_name: Meeting Room CC1.3, Coventry University Enterprises Ltd
venue_street: The TechnoCentre, Coventry University Technology Park, Puma Way,
name: Refugees and Migrants - Untapped Talent
html_description:
The MiFriendy Cities Programme supports skilled refugees and migrants to find employment opportunities across Coventry and Warwickshire. Employers often overlook the possibility of recruiting skilled refugees and migrants due to misconceptions around their ‘Right to Work’ status. This untapped talent pipeline may offer solutions for employers looking to fill long-term skills gaps and this informative workshop will offer information and guidance around this, including current legislation.

At this event, an overview of the MiFriendly Cities Programme will be provided, focusing on the support options available for employers to enable them to fill vacancies and skills gaps from the MiFriendly Cities Programme's pool of skilled participants.

The event is aimed at all businesses across Coventry and Warwickshire from SMEs to National/International businesses, who have a presence in the region. Senior HR/Recruitment Professionals would benefit from attendance. 

Attendees will gain the latest information on 'Right to Work' legislation and a demo of the 'RightCheck' App, also how the MiFriendly Cities programme can become a free recruitment channel.

Agenda: 

1. Introductions

2. MiFriendly Cities Programme Overview

3. Presentation 1 - Right to Work Legislation, including a demo of RightCheck App

4. Presentation 2 - Refugees and Migrants - Untapped Talent

5. Q&A's

6. Networking

Speakers: 

James Miller - MiFriendly Cities Programme Director

Paul Herring - RightCheck Commercial Director

name: Scanning the Horizon: Using digital solutions to future proof critical records
html_description:
Join Warwickshire County Record Office at this informative event which will explore how digitisation can improve your agility and responsiveness as a business. The session will provide an overview of the digitisation of records, the process involved and the benefits accrued from doing so.

Digitisation is key to ensuring you can respond quickly to customer needs and operate efficiently.  In times of increasing pressure, it is key that business is able to access information quickly and are not hindered by a lack of access to critical business records.  Digitisation can improve the experience of both your business and your customer.

Confirmed Speakers

Robert Eyre, Senior Archivist

Robert Pitt, Senior Conservation & Reprographics Assistant and Digital Training Officer

Agenda

10:00 – 10:15 Tour of the facilities (including examples of completed work)

10:15 – 10:30 Introduction to basics of digitisation             

10:30 – 11:00 Demonstration

name: Insta-your-Gram for Beginners - Leamington
html_description:
Do you run a business and are confused by Instagram? Don’t know what or how to use Instagram for business? What is a hashtag? Step into this Instagram experience and come away with hidden tips and hacks to implement straight away on your own Instagram account.

Danielle Fletcther, a Certified Social Media Marketer specialising in coaching businesses to use Instagram as a marketing tool, will guide you through this no-jargon session to help you feel uber confident.  

My interactive session will cover:

  • Beginners guide to Instagram why your business needs to be on there?
  • How to use it effectively to generate sales, leads and get bums on seats
  • Explanation of the 4 main ingredients that make the most inviting social cake which is made up of the Feed, Stories, Live and IGTV
  • Demystifying hashtags?
  • What the heck is a bio and why is it important?

This event is aimed at anyone in busiess who wants to learn how to use Instagram as a marketing tool. 

Refreshments will be available to purchase.

Important: Attendees at this event should bring a charged-up mobile phone and have an active Instagram account.

name: Make Your Existing Clients Into Your Best Source of New Business
html_description:
Did you know… On average it costs 8 times more to attract a new customer to your business than it does to keep an existing one? (In some industries this stat is even worse).  Join Burgis and Bullock on the 21st November to discover several, recommended low or no-cost strategies that you could immediately implement within your business. Not only could this strengthen client relationships, boost sales and profits but it could also ultimately transform existing clients into loyal and dedicated fans allowing you to reap the rewards. 

Who is the event is aimed at? Open Minded, Ambitious Entrepreneurs, Business Owners and Senior Managers. 

What will you gain from attending this event? Practical, low or no-cost strategies business owners can take away and implement immediately...Look after your existing clients properly and they will buy more and refer more.  

Agenda: 

1:00pm - Identifying your Most Wanted and Ideal Clients

1:40pm - Increasing conversion by as much as x4 overnight

2:20pm - Break

2:40pm - Maximising Client Engagement, Retention and Referrals

3:20pm - Compound Impact, Planning and Financial Management

4:00pm - Q&A informal networking

4:30pm - Close

Speakers: 

Sean Farnell - Accountant and Business Growth Expert - Partner at Burgis and Bullock Chartered Accountants, (www.burgisbullock.com)

David Mack - Highly Experienced Business Coach and owner of Trinity CPD Training Ltd, (www.bb-bmg.uk)

Steve Darnell - Client Engagement Specialist - Director of Enquir3 Ltd, (www.enquir3.com)

venue_street: International Institute for Product & Service Innovation
name: Innovation in Action
html_description:
Would you like to increase manufacturing efficiency and grow profits?

Do you want to evolve your business?

Are you interested in learning from your peers?

--

This exclusive, invite-only event is a unique opportunity to share knowledge with businesses like you, as well as learning from the research and support centres who are helping innovation happen.

Please register to acknowledge your interest in attending this event. You will then be contacted by Sarah Pagan, CW Growth Hub, to confirm if you have been successful in qualifying for a place.

Our hands-on workshop is part of the Coventry and Warwickshire Business Festival, hosted by WMG, Coventry and Warwickshire Growth Hub, Coventry County Council, Warwickshire Country Council, Coventry University Enterprises and the MTC.

You will hear from business leaders who have improved efficiency and gained a competitive advantage through innovation. We will shine a spotlight on everything from routes to funding and collaboration opportunities, to small changes you can make today to revolutionise shop floor productivity. 

See Innovation in Action.

Join us for free at WMG’s International Institute for Product and Service Innovation centre (IIPSI). Refreshments and nibbles will be provided.

For more information, and to request an invite, please contact Sarah Pagan, sarah.pagan@cwgrowthhub.co.uk.

This event is aimed at business owners, managing directors, heads of innovation and business development managers, with a particular focus on the following sectors:

  • Advanced Manufacturing and Engineering
  • Healthcare
  • Digital & Creative  

Attendees will gain:

Key contacts into the local innovation support supply chain
Insight into local innovation case studies and inspiration on how to implement an innovative culture
Develop an action plan/ toolkit that attendees can take away and implement alongside an understanding of available support

To follow the event on social media – please @CWBFestival and #CWBF2019

Also, see - 

@WMGBusiness @CW_GrowthHub @coventrycc @the_MTC_org @CovUni_Business
